snippet: Since former President Hosni Mubarak of Egypt received a life sentence, a torrent of leaks has sprung suggesting that he may be nearing his end.
abstract: Fresh rumors about former Egyptian Pres Hosni Mubarak's failing health are surfacing daily, in stark contrast to his 30 years in power when such public speculation about his health was a crime; many Egyptians believe that the rumors are being leaked by the military government to manipulate public opinion, a measure of Egypt's unsettled state and the degree to which it is still haunted by divisions and doubts, old specters and fresh paranoia.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
byline.contributor: Mayy El Sheikh, Dina Saleh Amer and Robert Mackey contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Since former President Hosni Mubarak of Egypt received a life sentence, a torrent of leaks has sprung suggesting that he may be nearing his end.

headline.seo: Once Illegal, Health Rumors Now Have Mubarak Die Daily
headline.main: Once Illegal, Health Rumors Now Have Mubarak Die Daily
headline.print_headline: Once Illegal, Health Rumors Now Have Mubarak Die Daily
